left.jpg

Feedback appreciated from everyone. If you have an styling advice for this, feel free to drop a message here :slight_smile:
not sure about the width or text-align, but are we sure we want the transparency there?

@Vinit Singh the tooltip is looking awesome. But personally I didn't like the color of it. It's looking like ubuntu's default color to me. Can we go for Zulip's icon color or something like that? And I agree with @Yash RE transparency is mixing background words with the text.
The transparency was actually added by someone else. There already are tooltips (hovering over the gear in the left sidebar should make is visible) that were added and styled that way.
We can of course change it up for these tooltips, but I guess Rishi has to make the final decision on this one.
Same for the color. Anything that wasn't rendered from a handlerbars template has a bootstrap tooltip currently (instead of the html tooltips )
@Yash RE @Abhinav Singh I just pushed these changes to #11882. Please feel free to make any changes and share screenshots here for reference if you'd like. :slight_smile:

Right, if that's the default transperancy, I think it's fine.
You don't normally notice the background text behind the tooltips on CZO unless you look really hard.
I guess zooming it up makes it much more apparent.
I would suggest you use the night mode background color

I agree this will need some styling changes, though that can be done as a followup effort. I'm also skeptical of the transparency. Some small things:

  • Agreed about making it wider
  • There should be no "On". So "Last online: Mar 10".
    (Though I thought we were only doing dates for things in the previous year; so it would actually be "Last online: 9 days ago"?)

(Though I thought we were only doing dates for things in the previous year; so it would actually be "Last online: 9 days ago"?)

The change I made was:

  • If user was online within the last 90 days - > display Month and Day
  • If user was online more than 90 days ago, AND:
    • in the same year -> Display month and day
    • in the previous year -> Display Month, day and year

I think we currently only put a month and day (no year) if it's within 365 days ago? We should put a year if it's more than 90 days ago and it's a different year.
This is what the issue description said.

@Rishi Gupta Do you want me to change this to show the number of days in these cases?
yeah, let's just do number of days in the <= 90 days case, and keep the > 90 days case as is. Thanks!
Got it. Will do it right away.
